titleStmt.title: Richard T. Petree et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8958

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Muhlenberg Circuit Court
May Term May 1863
Pleas before the Honorable R T Petree
Judge of the Muhlenberg Circuit Court
Muhlenberg Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against
The County Court of Muhlenberg County
composed of W. G, Jones Presiding Judge
C D Morehead J P M C.
Jesse Millard J P M C
Absalom Low J P M C
M B Clark J P M C
H P Welborn J P. M. C
J L Sperting J P M C
John Downing J P M C
J J Wood J P M C
J J Wells J P M C.

The grand jury of Muhlenberg County in the name and by the Authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse the County Court of Muhlenberg County composed of W G. Jones P. J M. C. C D Morehead J P. Jesse Millard J. P. Absalom Low J P. M B Clark J. P. H P Welborn J. P. J. L Spurling J P. John Downing J P. J J Wood J. P. J J Wells of the office of failing to keep a good and Sufficient County Jail for Muhlenberg County committed as follows. towit The said County Court on the 15" day of May 1860 did fail to keep a good and sufficient County Jail for Muhlenberg
County against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

Information by Joseph Paptow John Jenkins W N James Ira C Skeprooth & D W Jerrigan
W. Y James Foreman of Grand Jury
Jno B Campbell Comths Atty Protem

The Commonwealth Plff
vs
W G Jones. C D Morehead Jesse Millard Absalom Low M B Clark H P Welborn J L Spurling John Downing J J Wood & J J Wells } All forfeitedThe County Judge & Justices of Muhg County Defts

This day came the attorney for the Commonwealth as well as the attorney for the defendants; and the attorneys agreeing that Judge must might go against the defendants for Fifty Dollars each, It is therefore adjudged by the Court that the Commonwealth of Kentucky recover of the defendants W G Jones, D C Morehead Jesse Millard Absalom Low M B Clark H P Welborn J L Spurling John Downing J J Wood and J J Wells the sum of Fifty Dollars each and her costs herein expended

The undersigned members of the bar, of the Circuit Court in Greenville Ky very Respectfully request his Excellency the Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky to remit the fines imposed upon the members of the Muhburg County ^Court^ at the present term of sd Circuit Court, for failing to Keep a suitable Jail Preparations are being made as we are informed to erect a new jail & we belileve the members of the County Court just passed the erection of a new County prision for prudential motives

R. T. Petree Cir Judge
H, G, Petree
B. E. Pittman
F M Bristow
S, W, Kennedy
W. B. Harrison
J, H, Lowry
S J Boyd
M, D, Hay
C. Eaves
Joseph Rickotts
Pettn of Members of the Muhlenberg County to remit fines

Muhlenberg Cir. Ct.
All the fines Remitted
J F Robinson
$50 each J. P. of Muhlenberg Co } Mis.
Issd Aug. 5. 1863
